tn.text: "builds up her house" or "makes her house better"
Possible meanings are 1) this may refer to her actual house, that is the building she lives in or 2) this may refer to her family. (UDB)
"Hands" represent the actions she does. AT: "by herself" or "by the way she behaves" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: The one who ... the one who
tn.text: "The person who ... the person who"
"Walks" represents the conduct of life. AT: "conducts his life in a just and honest way" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
"grossly disrespects" or "indicates he hates"
The word "his" refers to the dishonest man and "him" refers to Yahweh.

tn.ref: the mouth of ... the lips of
tn.text: The mouth and the lips both refer to what a person says. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
An offshoot is something that grows out of something else. AT: "what his pride produces" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
This word is actually a plural. "the wise men" or "wise people"
"will keep them from harm" or "will keep them safe"
A "trough" is a container in which you put the food for animals.
"a good harvest"

tn.ref: by the strength of an ox
tn.text: "Strength" represents the strong work an ox can do. AT: "because of the work an ox does" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

This figure of speech uses "breathes" to refer to lying constantly. AT: "constantly lies" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]]). See how you translated this phrase in [[:en:bible:notes:pro:06:17|6:19]].
"and wisdom is not there" or "but he will not find wisdom" (UDB)
"is easily found by" or "acquires without difficulty"
"the one who is wise" or "a person who has understanding"
The word "lips" represents what a person says. AT: "from his speech" or "with his comments" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
a person who has good judgment or sense
The word "way" represents the conduct of life of a person. AT: "his conduct" or "how he lives" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: the folly of fools is deception
tn.text: The foolishness of fools is that they think they are wise, when they are not.

tn.ref: when the guilt offering is sacrificed
tn.text: "at guilt" or "at the guilt offering" The meaning behind this phrase is that fools do not apologize to God or men for the things they do wrong.

tn.ref: but among the upright favor is shared
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "but the upright enjoy favor together" or "but God's favor is experienced together among the upright" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
"sorrow" or "sadness"
"those who do not know him"
The word "tent" represents everything that happens within it. AT: "the household" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

The word "flourish" means vigorous blooming of flowers and so represents anything that grows strongly. AT: "to do well and last long" or "to be healthy" or "to be very successful" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: There is a way that seems right to a man
tn.text: The word "way" represents the conduct of life a person follows. AT: "People think that the way they are living is the right way" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
The word "heart" represents a person's feelings, attitudes and motivations. AT: "A person's feelings can show laughter" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
"experience pain" or "hurt"
"The person who"
The word "ways" represents a person's conduct of life. AT: "what he deserves, based on how he lived" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
"what belongs to him" or "what he has a right to"
"inexperienced, immature"
Here the idea of footsteps represents a person's behavior. AT: "his actions" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
Here evil is spoken of as if it were a place. AT: "avoids doing evil" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
"boldly ignores"
"becomes angry quickly"
"inexperienced, immature"
Here "inherit" represents having permanent possession of something.  (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
The word "foolishness" is an abstract noun that represents foolish thinking and foolish actions.
"wise people"
Here knowledge is spoken of as if it were a beautiful ornament worn on one's head, such as a turban with jewels. AT: "wear knowledge as a turban" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

This means to bend over to humbly express respect and honor toward someone. Here this one action represents all yielding to the more influential person. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])

tn.ref: at the gates of the righteous
tn.text: The word "gates" represents an entrance to meet with another. This means the wicked will have to wait for the righteous person and beg to enter his presence. AT: "to meet with the righteous person." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: The poor person is hated even by his own companions
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Everyone hates the poor person even his own neighbors" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
"The person ... the person"
"poor people"

tn.ref: Do not those who plot evil go astray?
tn.text: The assumed answer to this question is "yes". AT: "Those who plot evil will go astray." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
"who make evil plans" or "who make plans to do evil things"

tn.ref: but when there is only talk
tn.text: "but if you only talk" or "but when all a person does is talking"
The word "crown" represents the highest achievement possible and visible to all. AT: "The reward of wise people" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
Translate this phrase as in [[:en:bible:notes:pro:14:07|14:8]].

This figure of speech uses "breathes" to refer to lying constantly. See how you translated this phrase in [[:en:bible:notes:pro:06:17|6:19]]. AT: "constantly lies" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
A "fountain" is a bountiful source of water and represents here the source of life. AT: "source of life" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
A "snare" is a sort of trap used to hunt animals and represents something tricky and dangerous that will kill. AT: "from the trap that will kill" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: the great number of his people
tn.text: "how many people he rules"
"the prince has nothing and his kingdom will fall"
tempered** - a person who is quick to become angry
"A peaceful mindset" or "An attitude that is at peace"
The word "rots" represents the decay of a person and "bones" represents the whole person. AT: "causes a person to be unhealthy in body and spirit" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: The one who ... the one who
tn.text: "The person who ... the person who"
This means to express a desire that bad things will happen to someone.
"a poor person ... a needy person"
"is kind to" or "helps"

tn.ref: is brought down by his evil actions
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "evil actions push over" or "evil actions destroy" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
The word "heart" represents the feelings, attitudes and motivations of a person. AT: "Wisdom is in the attitude" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
"a discerning person"
This can be stated in active form. AT: "she makes sure people know her" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
The word "she" refers to wisdom. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])
"bring shame upon"
"wisely"
"the servant who"
